  "article_text": [
    "a kleinian reflection group @xmath0 is a discrete group generated by reflections in the faces of hyperbolic polyhedron @xmath1 .",
    "we may assume that the dihedral angles of @xmath2 are of the form @xmath3 , @xmath4 , in which case @xmath2 forms a fundamental domain for the action of @xmath0 on @xmath5 .",
    "if @xmath2 has finite volume , then @xmath6 is a hyperbolic orbifold of finite volume , which is obtained by `` mirroring '' the faces of @xmath2 .",
    "andreev gave a combinatorial characterization of hyperbolic reflection groups in 3-dimensions , in terms of the topological type of @xmath2 and the dihedral angles assigned to the edges of @xmath2 @xcite .",
    "a reflection group @xmath0 is maximal if there is no reflection group @xmath7 such that @xmath8 .",
    "we ll defer the definition of arithmetic groups until later , but a theorem of margulis implies that @xmath0 is arithmetic if and only if @xmath9=\\infty$ ] , where @xmath10<\\infty\\}$ ] @xcite .",
    "the main theorem of this paper is that there are only finitely many arithmetic kleinian groups which are maximal reflection groups .",
    "the argument generalizes an argument of long - maclachlan - reid @xcite , which implies that there are only finitely many arithmetic minimal hyperbolic 2-orbifolds with bounded genus .",
    "their argument is in fact a generalization of an argument of zograf @xcite , who reproved that there are only finitely many congruence groups @xmath0 commensurable with @xmath11 such that @xmath12 has genus @xmath13 ( this was proven originally by dennin @xcite , and was known as rademacher s conjecture )",
    ". the key ingredient of their argument is a theorem of vigneras @xcite ( based on work of gelbart - jacquet @xcite and jacquet - langlands @xcite ) , which implies that a congruence arithmetic fuchsian group has @xmath14 ( and which has a generalization to higher dimensions @xcite ) .",
    "the other key ingredient is an estimate of zograf @xcite , which implies that for a hyperbolic 2-orbifold @xmath15 , @xmath16 is bounded linearly by the genus of @xmath15 .",
    "zograf s argument is based on a sequence of improvements of a result of szgo ( who did this for planar domains)@xcite , by hersch ( for @xmath17)@xcite , yang - yau ( for orientable surfaces ) @xcite , and li - yau ( for non - orientable surfaces and manifolds of a fixed conformal type)@xcite .",
    "we observe that the li - yau argument ( sharpened by el soufi - ilias @xcite ) generalizes to orbifolds , and we then apply this to arithmetic kleinian reflection groups .    in the concluding section , we consider how one might generalize this result to higher dimensions to prove    [ finite ] there are only finitely many maximal arithmetic reflection groups in @xmath18 , @xmath19 .",
    "conformal volume was first defined by li - yau , partially motivated by generalizing results on surfaces due to yang - yau , hersch , and szgo .",
    "we generalize this notion to orbifolds .",
    "let @xmath20 be a compact riemannian orbifold , possibly with boundary .",
    "let @xmath21 denote the underlying topological space .",
    "denote the volume form by @xmath22 , and @xmath23 its volume .",
    "let @xmath24 denote the conformal transformations of @xmath25 .",
    "it is well - known that @xmath26 .",
    "@xmath21 has a codimension zero dense open subset which is a riemannian manifold .",
    "we will say that a map @xmath27 is _ pc _ if it is a continous map which is piecewise conformal on the open submanifold of @xmath28 which maps to the manifold part of @xmath29 . clearly , if @xmath30 is pc , and @xmath31 , then @xmath32 is also pc .",

    "* remark : * for our application , it would suffice to define a pc map to be lipschitz and _ a.e .",
    "_ conformal .",
    "it seems likely that our definition of conformal volume coincides with that of li - yau for manifolds , but we have not checked this ( it would suffice to show that a pc map can be approximated by conformal maps ) .",
    "if there exists a piecewise isometric map @xmath39 for some @xmath38 , then clearly @xmath37 is well - defined , since @xmath40 has a conformal embedding into @xmath25 . for an orbifold @xmath20 ,",
    "to prove that @xmath37 is well - defined , one need only check that @xmath41 embeds piecewise isometrically into some compact riemannian manifold , in which case the nash - moser isometric embedding theorem implies that @xmath41 embeds piecewise isometrically into @xmath40 , for some @xmath38",
    ". we will only apply conformal volume to orbifolds which will obviously have a pc map to @xmath25 , for some @xmath38 .",
    "we record basic facts about conformal volume which were recorded in @xcite , and which carry over to our notion of conformal volume for orbifolds .",

    "if so , then one should be able to prove conjecture [ ellipticconformalvolume ] .",
    "we suspect the answer to this question is no , which is why we have not been able to generalize the proof in this section to higher dimensions .",

    "we put together the results in the previous sections to prove our main theorem .",
    "there are only finitely many arithmetic maximal reflection groups in @xmath168 .",
    "suppose that @xmath0 is an arithmetic maximal reflection group .",
    "that is , there is no group @xmath169 , with @xmath170 , such that @xmath7 is generated by reflections",
    ". then there exists @xmath171 , such that @xmath172 is a maximal kleinian group .",
    "@xmath0 is generated by reflections in a finite volume polyhedron @xmath2 .",
    "( vinberg @xcite ) @xmath0 is a normal subgroup of @xmath172 .",
    "moreover , there is a finite subgroup @xmath173 such that @xmath174 is an isomorphism , and @xmath175 preserves the polyhedron @xmath2 .",
    "this follows from the fact that the set of reflections in @xmath172 is conjugacy invariant , and therefore the group generated by reflections is normal in @xmath172 .",
    "since @xmath0 is a maximal reflection group , this subgroup must be @xmath0 .",
    "the polyhedron @xmath2 is a fundamental domain of @xmath0 , and if there is an element @xmath176 such that @xmath177 , then @xmath178 .",
    "otherwise , there would be a geodesic plane @xmath179 containing a face of @xmath2 , such that @xmath180 .",
    "the reflection @xmath181 in the plane @xmath179 would be conjugate to a reflection @xmath182 , which is not in @xmath0 since @xmath183 , which implies that @xmath0 is not a maximal reflection group , a contradiction .",

    ", @xmath199 is a smooth function , so it descends to an eigenfunction @xmath200 of @xmath164 on @xmath15 with eigenvalue @xmath195 .",
    "conversely , if @xmath200 is an eigenfunction of @xmath164 on @xmath15 with eigenvalue @xmath201 , then @xmath202 gives an eigenfunction on @xmath194 with neumann boundary conditions , since the level sets of @xmath199 must be invariant under reflections , and therefore perpendicular to the faces of @xmath2 .",

    "now , we apply the eigenvalue estimates : @xmath217 thus , we obtain @xmath218 since volumes of arithmetic hyperbolic orbifolds are discrete , and @xmath172 is uniquely determined by @xmath0 , we conclude that there are only finitely many arithmetic maximal reflection groups .",
    "from the main theorem , we conclude that given an arithmetic reflection group @xmath219 , it must lie in one of finitely many maximal reflection groups ( up to conjugacy ) .",
    "if @xmath0 is a reflection group in a polyhedron @xmath2 for which all the dihedral angles are @xmath220 or all are @xmath221 , then there are infinitely many co - finite volume reflection subgroups of @xmath0 . thus we see that there are commensurability classes of arithmetic groups for which there are infinitely many reflection groups in the commensurability class , and thus in our finiteness result , the maximality assumption is crucial .",
    "it is an interesting project to try to identify all arithmetic maximal reflection groups , and to classify their reflection subgroups of finite covolume .    for the non - compact examples",
    ", one may apply volume formulae to estimate the maximal discriminant of a quadratic imaginary number field @xmath121 for which @xmath222 contains a reflection group .",
    "humbert first computed the covolumes of bianchi groups , and a generalization due to borel implies that for a non - compact arithmetic kleinian group , the minimal covolume @xmath223 satisfies @xmath224 where @xmath225 is the class number of the number field @xmath121 .",
    "the brauer - siegel theorem gives an estimate of @xmath225 for a number field , and implies for a quadratic imaginary number field @xmath121 that @xmath226 where @xmath227 is the order of the group of roots of unity in @xmath121 . if @xmath228 , then @xmath229 ( see the proof of theorem 11.7.2 @xcite ) .",
    "thus , we have @xmath230 thus @xmath231 .",
    "hatcher has computed orbifold structures of some of the bianchi groups of small discriminant , and from his pictures one may deduce that @xmath232 is commensurable with a reflection group for @xmath233 where @xmath121 is a quadratic imaginary number field @xcite . in principle , it ought to be possible to compute all arithmetic reflection groups , but clearly even in the non - compact case , the volume estimates we obtain do not make this computation feasible . to classify non - compact kleinian arithmetic groups , it may require the infusion of some more number theory .",
    "arithmetic restrictions have been found on reflection groups containing the bianchi groups by vinberg @xcite and blume - nienhaus @xcite .",
    "if these results could be extended to all maximal non - compact arithmetic groups , then one may be able to give a complete classification .",
    "the classification of compact arithmetic maximal reflection groups , although in principle decidable , is probably not feasible at this stage .",
    "it s clear that for a finite volume polyhedron @xmath234 , @xmath235 , so @xmath236 thus in @xmath38 dimensions , there are finitely many reflection groups @xmath237 which have a lower bound on @xmath238",
    ". it would be interesting if one could generalize the arguments of the main theorem to higher dimensions .",
    "it is known by work of prokhorov that there can not be any reflection groups in dimension @xmath239 @xcite ( vinberg showed that compact reflection groups can not exist in dimension @xmath240 @xcite ) .",
    "vinberg also gave a characterization of arithmetic reflection groups , in terms of a totally real field of definition @xmath241 and an integrality condition @xcite .",
    "nikulin has shown that there exists a constant @xmath242 such that the set of arithmetic groups in @xmath18 generated by reflections with @xmath243 and @xmath244 > n_{0}$ ] is empty @xcite .",
    "it was proved in a previous paper by nikulin that the set of maximal arithmetic groups generated by reflections in @xmath18 with a fixed degree @xmath244 $ ] is finite @xcite .",
    "thus , to generalize the main argument of this paper , one would have to bound the conformal volume of a minimal arithmetic @xmath38-orbifold containing a reflection suborbifold up to dimensions @xmath245 . by the characterization of maximal arithmetic groups in @xmath18",
    ", it should follow that they are congruence . by a result of burger - sarnak , if @xmath237 is a congruence arithmetic reflection group with @xmath246 , then @xmath247 ( cor .",
    "1.3 @xcite , and the fact that reflection groups are defined by quadratic forms ) .",
    "every maximal arithmetic group covered by a reflection group will embed conformally in an elliptic @xmath38-orbifold .",
